blockRepresentation
Class ExpressionSubBlock

java.lang.Object
  blockRepresentation.IBlock
      blockRepresentation.ExpressionSubBlock

public class ExpressionSubBlock
extends IBlock

Author:
Francesco This class represent an expression in the program input tree. Massive use of recursion is uden in this data representation. An object ExpressionSubBlock can be of tree different types: - "identifier" : eg. [ x ], or [ A[10] ] - "constant" : eg. [ 4 ], or [ -4 ] - "recursiveExpression" : eg. [ x + 2 ] or [ x + ( ( 4 + 5 ) * 6 ) ]

involvesArray

public boolean involvesArray()
Description copied from class: IBlock
Checks whether the block antains any array reference, here the default answer "no", is defined. The sub classes answering "yes" will just override the method

get_negative_inside

public java.util.ArrayList<ExpressionSubBlock> get_negative_inside()
Extracts the negated inner expressions form this expression. Every element of the ArrayList has to be considered negative as a whole

Returns:
The ArrayList of the negated expressions
